content:
That's wonderful to hear! It's great that you've found an instructor like Maria who makes you feel comfortable and helps you learn effectively. Having a good instructor can make all the difference in your learning experience, especially when you're new to dance.

Breaking down steps is an essential skill for any dance instructor, and it's fantastic that Maria is able to do so in a way that works for you. It's also excellent that she's helped you feel comfortable and confident, which is crucial for learning and enjoying the dance.

As you prepare for the bachata festival, you might find that you'll encounter different teaching styles and approaches. Some instructors might focus more on technique, while others might emphasize musicality or expression. Be open to learning from each instructor, and don't be afraid to ask questions or clarify steps if you're unsure.

Remember, the most important thing is to have fun and enjoy the process of learning. Bachata is a beautiful dance style, and I'm sure you'll have a great time exploring it with different instructors.

By the way, has Maria given you any tips or advice on how to prepare for the festival or learn from different instructors?
